Case reference: 2023001230.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2023, John Michael Fongémie was last seen. Since that time, no bank transactions have been recorded, nor have any calls been made on his cell phone. Extensive searches for John Michael were conducted with no success.

Tattoo: Right Leg, Yin Yang symbol, yellow and blue
Upper Left Back, Two initials, possibly "G" and "J"

Case reference: 2014005409.CaseDesc: Rene Bruneau was last seen at Saskatchewan Hospital in North Battleford on June 27, 1965. Mr. Bruneau was noticed missing the next morning. He is from Leoville, Saskatchewan. His immediate family have not heard from or seen Mr. Bruneau.

Scar: Head, Surgical scar on forehead, ear to ear, from removal of tumour

Case reference: 2006012899.CaseDesc: Delmar Henderson was last seen in the area of Burnt River (Kinmount), Ontario on June 2, 1983.

Case reference: 2010003799.CaseDesc: On Wednesday August 16, 1972, at 9:40 pm, 14 year-old Ingrid Bauer left her residence in Kleinburg, now the city of Vaughan, enroute to meet her boyfriend at his North Woodbridge home. She was last seen hitchhiking southbound along the west side of Islington Avenue.  She never arrived at her boyfriend’s residence that night.  An extensive search based on information received from the public failed to locate Ingrid Bauer.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2006011199.CaseDesc: On May 9, 1986, Gregory Beaumont left the Silver Lake Campground by boat to fish on the lake. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014002336.CaseDesc: On March 22, 1993, Yolande Bouchard was going to meet her sister at the mall in Trois-Rivières at 4:00 p.m. She never arrived and was reported missing at that time. Her car was later found in Trois-Rivières Ouest with two offence tickets on the windshield.

Case reference: 2013000130.CaseDesc: Norman Rivet was last seen on May 24, 1983 at home in Ville-Émard, a neighbourhood of Montreal.  He left a suicide note to his family.

Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002535.CaseDesc: Ginette Landry was seen for the last time in Montreal on April 15, 1994. Ms. Landry would often travel for missions to help people in need.

Case reference: 2013000053.CaseDesc: On October 20 2010, OPP were called to the Iroquois Locks, Iroquois ON by the Captain of a Bulk Laker reporting that crew member Gary Charlton had not shown up for his noon shift.  Crew members and the OPP conducted searches of the vessel without locating Charlton.  He was last seen on the vessel by crew members at 4:10 a.m., October 20, 2010 when the vessel was in Lake Ontario in the Cobourg area.

Case reference: 2014004591.CaseDesc: In July 2004, Philip Leishman left his residence with a friend from Kakisa Lake, Northwest Territories. Philip had told his family that he would be travelling to Fort McMurray, Alberta, and it was confirmed that he was in Fort McMurray until late August of 2004. Philip has ties to Port Alberni, British Columbia, Grand Prairie, Alberta, and Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001268.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1998, Terry Jasman wandered off from the Bow City Gravel Pit on the Bow River near Brooks, Alberta.  Terry Jasman's trailer and truck were later found abandoned.

Jeans: Denim, Light Blue, Faded blue jeans

Case reference: 2008005698.CaseDesc: On February 16th, 1994, Calvin Simms was last seen in the area of Church street in St.Catharines, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Calvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2023009705.CaseDesc: Paul Davis was last seen on November 5, 2022 when he went swimming off of the shores of Saint John West near the Bay Ferry dock in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014002202.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1991, Doctor Jitinkumar Devchand Karamshi Shah, a physician with Sir Thomas Roddick Hospital in Stephenville, Newfoundland, was last seen at 2:45 in the morning. After a night out at a local club, Dr. Shah dropped a friend off at their residence and continued walking home. Dr. Shah was born in Nairobi, Kenya and previously lived and worked in Sheffield, England.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2006018999.CaseDesc: Sean MacIntyre was 13 years old at the time of a boating accident on July 25, 1980. The boat he was in started to take on water just after leaving Cockburn Island. The boat sank quickly in Lake Huron, North Channel, 2 kilometres Southwest of Bigsby Island. Occupants of the boat put on life jackets. Sean slipped out of his life jacket and is presumed  drowned. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014006268.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Brandon Jakobek was seen for the last time flying a plane from Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. Brandon, a Morningstar Air pilot and avid skydiver, had flown in from Toronto to deliver parcels for FedEx. He had informed employees prior to his departure that a warning light had illuminated during his flight and that he needed to run some diagnostic checks. The plane was never found and is thought to be in the Hudson Bay.

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2023031497.CaseDesc: On 2022-06-02, Michael Vanrookhuyzen was last seen in Chaplin, Saskatchewan where he had mentioned that he was going to see a friend in Toronto, Ontario.  Michael has not been seen or heard from his family or friends in over a year. Michael suffers from paranoid schizophrenia.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2013000124.CaseDesc: Maxwell Brown is from Bella Bella and traveled to Klemtu to look for work in late April 2012.  He was last seen in Klemtu on May 1, 2012.

Hat: Black, BASEBALL, Baseball cap with "C" on front
Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, "REST IN PEACE"

Case reference: 2014004770.CaseDesc: At approximately 11:00 p.m. on April 17, 2006, Sangeeta Khanna called a family member and told him that she was going to stop at the bank and then would be home shortly. In the morning when she did not arrive the police were called. Her vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot in Edmonton and she has not been seen since. The investigation is ongoing and investigators believe that Sangeeta may be the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2023019635.CaseDesc: Sridhar Nidammanuri's roommate last saw him on April 21, 2023, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Québec. Sridhar left behind his Indian passport, wallet, banking cards and identification.  Sridhar speaks English and is known to travel on foot.  Authorities have reasons to be concerned about his well-being.

Sweater: Red, White, Red sweater with white stripes
Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right cheek
Left Eye, Mole near the left eye

Case reference: 2013000133.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2013, Prince Edward OPP (Picton) were advised of a 30 ft sailboat that had run aground on the shores at Point Petre (Lake Ontario). It was determined that the sailboat was from Rochester, New York and had left the Chimney Bluff State Park Marina (New York) on July 13,  2013 in the morning. Based on GPS tracks the investigators suspect that Scott French went overboard in American waters, and the boat drifted into Canadian Waters.

Hair: Brown, Brush Cut, Balding at the front
Shoes: Leather, White, New Balance, Running shoe

Case reference: 2020007795.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1972, at around midnight, James Edwards was last seen in his Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) uniform leaving for work in Toronto, Ontario. TTC advised that James had submitted his resignation before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2021050990.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2021, Antony Anuj was last heard from via text message. The origin tower signals of the texts were traced to the Niagara Falls, Ontario area.

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2014003382.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1988, Stanley Umpherville and a friend were driving to The Pas, Manitoba where they stayed the night. In the morning the two departed The Pas via a 20 foot yawl with the intent on going to Easterville. They departed the Umpherville settlement around 1300hrs and they briefly stopped at Pine Bluff around 1600 hrs. It is believed they then stopped at a friend's trappers cabin at Rat Hunting and ate a meal. The last thing the survivor remembers, is seeing the lights of Easterville and he crawled to the front of the boat where he fell asleep. He awoke around 0500 hrs the next day and Stanley was no longer in the boat and he was adrift. Numerous islands and shorelines in the area were searched, and several air and water patrols were made without success. Stanley has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Hat: Grey, Baseball style with "Hi Ho Hi Ho" on front

Case reference: 2014005031.CaseDesc: Eric Gagnon was seen for the last time over the course of the night on May 25-26, 1996 in Trois-Pistoles, Quebec. Eric drove his ex-girlfriend to "Le Bellevue" Night Club sometime in the early hours of the evening. His vehicle was later recovered at his home.

Case reference: 2014002267.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1992, Pawel Gazdzicki was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Pawel was despondent, suffered from mental health issues, and may have lost his memory. He had mentioned wanting to jump off of the Champlain Bridge.

Case reference: 2012020032.CaseDesc: Lorilee Francis was last known to be in Grande Prairie, Alberta. She has not been heard from by family or friends since approximately October of 2007.

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2014004874.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2006, Tracy Forde was seen for the last time at her home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002341.CaseDesc: On June 23, 1979, Terrence Henderson was last seen canoeing on Lac St. Anne in Ross Haven, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014006338.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1988, George Burke was last seen by his wife, when he left their residence in Edmonton, Alberta, to take the bus to work. That day, George did not arrive at work, and it is unknown whether he caught the bus.

Case reference: 2014003747.CaseDesc: Karoly John "Charles" Horvath, a visitor from England, arrived in Kelowna BC in early May 1989.  He worked throughout the community at part time jobs and stayed in a local hostel and at a local campground.  He was last seen on Friday, May 26, 1989.  All his belongings were left behind at the campground where he had been staying.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, side profile of a skull with mohawk style haircut

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014003937.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1990, Reynald Fortin was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. He was known to be despondent and to consume alcohol. Reynald left his apartment without his identification or money.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2013000098.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1974, eight men were on a drilling barge. As they were making no headway against a strong current, it was agreed upon to park the barge for the night. The eight men worked together to park the vessel however one of the legs failed to lower, causing the barge to tip. Donald Bradburn was amongst the men who were thrown from the barge. Despite dragging operations Donald has never been located.

Case reference: 2010003099.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2010, OPP received a report that support cheques for Shelley Anderson of Cobalt Ontario, were returned uncashed for the past 12 months. Police attempted to locate her but were unsuccessful. She was last seen in the Haileybury and Cobalt area some time during the summer of 2009. Ms. Anderson also has ties to the Timmins and Schumacher areas, as she lived there for most of her life.

Case reference: 2012020048.CaseDesc: Kathleen Johnston went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 2:15 p.m. on October 20, 1953. Miss Johnston got off of a city transit bus on her way to work at the Gem Café in the downtown area after visiting her mother at her residence.

Case reference: 2014004626.CaseDesc: In March of 1975, Barry “Rocky” Fiddler was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at the Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2006010699.CaseDesc: Greg Gan departed from the family home, on foot, on October 19, 1978. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.
Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.

Case reference: 2018063467.CaseDesc: On December 12, 1995, at approximately 2:00 am, Ahmad Kharashfeh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Short jacket with 2 red lines in the front

Case reference: 2014005315.CaseDesc: Darryl Dubitski was last seen by his family leaving his residence in Edmonton, Alberta in December of 1982. Darryl had informed his family that he was travelling to the United States.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014003329.CaseDesc: Jan Rynberk was last seen leaving his residence in Welland, Ontario, on November 29, 1987. Jan's vehicle was located on December 1,1987, in a parking lot in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004835.CaseDesc: Ashleigh Pettman was last seen on June 3 2005 in the downtown area of Kelowna, British Columbia. She had moved to Kelowna from Grand Prairie, Alberta in March 2005 to live with her grandmother. In May 2005, Ashleigh gathered her belongings and moved out of her grandmother's residence to an unknown location.

Case reference: 2014001381.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1982, Patricia Elizabeth Flynn was last seen running away from her family residence in a densely wooded area near her home in Yarrow, British-Colombia. Patricia was despondent and had medical issues that required attention at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006011799.CaseDesc: Thomas Lyon was last seen in the area of Iron Bridge, Pelican Lake, Sioux Lookout on June 28, 1998 by two acquaintances.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003100.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1995, Jacob Sallenback was seen for the last time at his residence in Calgary, AB.

Shirt: Other, TEE, Kings Crew logo, Aqua

Case reference: 2014005579.CaseDesc: In the early hours of January 17, 1991, Darrell Watt was seen for the last time as he left the Beverly Crest Hotel tavern in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of his disappearance, Darrell was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and was a known associate of a motorcycle club.

Case reference: 2006014699.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1996, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Melanie Ethier was seen for the last time as she left a friend’s residence to walk to her residence in New Liskeard, Ontario. The distance between her home and her friend’s residence was a kilometre, but Melanie never arrived home. Foul play is suspected.

Shirt: Cotton, White, a blue heart ("Pepe" logo) t-shirt

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2014005223.CaseDesc: On March 4th, 2009, Wesley Foulds , 52, left his Abbotsford residence for an appointment in New Westminster.  Mr. Foulds didn't arrive for his appointment, and didn't show up for work later that day.  Mr. Foulds' vehicle was discovered the next day parked near the Hayward Dam in Mission BC.

Case reference: 2020010761.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1983, at approximately 11:00am, Rudolf Jakob was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shirt: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Striped; Light blue and dark blue

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014004759.CaseDesc: On March 21st 2006, Tayven Bear was playing with two other children on the ice of the Churchill River in Sandy Bay, Saskatchewan. Tayven fell into the river and he was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014004973.CaseDesc: Luke Retieff was last seen by his mother at his residence on July 21, 2007. He had been prescribed numerous medications for his medical conditions. He was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Wavy, Light brown goatee
Boots: Leather, Brown, hiking boots, shoe size 9 - 10
Coat: Nylon, Red, Ski jacket with black and white stripes on arms

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2018040276.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1992, at approximately 12:00pm, Luom Truong was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to leaving his home, Luom and his mother had an argument.

Case reference: 2014002901.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1981, Carlos Yuste was residing with friends in Thompson, Manitoba. He departed the residence and never returned. Carlos left behind all his clothing and personal belongings. He was described by his friends as being very depressed due to his unemployment. Mr. Yuste has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Aliases: GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel
YUSTE GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel

Case reference: 2014003872.CaseDesc: Diane Bélanger was last seen on August 8, 1982, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Denis Beauchamp was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Denis went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2024041945.CaseDesc: Patrick Copelin was seen on March 11, 2011, leaving his residence in Niagara Falls, New York, USA.  Shortly after, he was seen jumping into Niagara Falls at Prospect Point.  At the time of his disappearance, Patrick was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.

Case reference: 2014003816.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1992, Stéphane Murray left his residence in the Beauport area to attend an appointment. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Death's head and a bat

Case reference: 2022011021.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2022, Nicholas Adamson was seen for the last time walking away from an establishment in the area of Sullivan Avenue and Front Street South in Thorold, Ontario.

Shirt: White, BUTTON UP, Short sleeve button up
Tattoo: Left Chest, Head of a wolf

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2014005162.CaseDesc: Steve Messervie was seen for the last time on October 6, 2008 in Montreal, Quebec.  Steve had been in hospital, however his identity had not been confirmed through identification documents.  Steve had been diagnosed as having amnesia prior to leaving the hospital.

Case reference: 2020011912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2017, Jeffrey Caporale was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Shortly before his disappearance, Jeffrey had been treated at the University of Alberta hospital.

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005838.CaseDesc: Dale Jackson was last seen on June 28, 2010 in Edmonton, Alberta.  Dale left behind all his personal belongings including his cell phone.

Case reference: 2014002034.CaseDesc: In 1968, Christina Littlejohn was last seen on the Roseau River First Nation reserve in Manitoba. Further investigations by the RCMP revealed that Christina had been murdered by her common law partner. In 2002, the RCMP’s Cold Case Unit laid murder charges against her common law partner, however he passed away before the trial commenced. To date Christina’s remains have not been located.

Teeth: Other, She is missing a tooth on the lower right jaw

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2023049573.CaseDesc: Olivier St-Denis was last seen while out for a walk on September 10, 2023, in the town of Malartic, in the Regional Municipality of La Vallée-de-l'Or, in Quebec. Olivier has not been seen and we have not heard from him since that time.

Sweater: Cotton, Green, khaki checkered pattern vest

Case reference: 2014006991.CaseDesc: Maxime Perreault was living alone and in an isolated area in the municipality of East Bolton and was working in the municipality of Eastman, in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. On April 28, 2014, Maxime contacted his family and friends stating that he would visit them around May 3, 2014 in Beloeil, Quebec. He never arrived. He usually travels on foot, by bike, by bus or hitchhiking with a navy blue backpack.

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2014003765.CaseDesc: On the morning of August 11, 1994, Neil Hicks was seen for the last time leaving his temporary residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Neil suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2023061459.CaseDesc: Darwin Johnsgaard was seen for the last time on October 18, 2023, at the Dollarama in Strathmore, Alberta.  Darwin frequents the Mustard Seed Shelter in Calgary, Alberta.

Hat: Black, BALL CAP, Gas Monkey Garage
Scar: Right Side Of Head, Scar right side of head

Case reference: 2006017799.CaseDesc: Véronique Courchesne was last seen at her residence November 11, 1979. She was depressed due to a recent medical diagnosis. She had withdrawn money from her bank account prior to going missing. On December 31, 1979 she contacted her husband by telephone but has not been heard from since.

Amputation: Right Chest, Mastectomy to the right breast

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: Leslie Anne Katnick was reported missing by her father on November 4, 1991, to Montreal Police. Leslie had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that Leslie registered into the Halifax, Nova Scotia YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.
